alert.note: Alert for Kern (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 20 at 3:36PM PDT until August 20 at 5:30PM PDT by NWS Hanford
info.description: The National Weather Service in Hanford has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... South Central Kern County in central California... * Until 530 PM PDT. * At 336 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Tehachapi. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
